title: Modern Serif
content:
I know this is going to sound absurd, but I am in desperate need of a serif typeface that has a very modern feel to it. I’m looking for sharp serifs like in Cochin. However, Cochin has too many curves. Bodoni and Fenice get too thick. Filosofia is too curvy. I need it to be very tight, sleek and sharp with serifs. I think I may have to just create it myself.

 [‹ type suggestions](http://web.archive.org/web/20080628180740/http:/typophile.com/node/16751 "Go to previous forum topic") [About Aspect ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080628180740/http:/typophile.com/node/16747 "Go to next forum topic")
author: vigorgraphics

comments.content:
Hmmm....  
Modernish with sharp serifs.  
For “classics” try:  
 [Meridien](http://web.archive.org/web/20080628180740/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/meridien/) by Adrian Frutiger  
or [Perpetua](http://web.archive.org/web/20080628180740/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/perpetua-2/) by Eric Gill

For more contemporary treatments try:  
 [Eidetic Neo](http://web.archive.org/web/20080628180740/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/emigre/eidetic-neo/) by Rodrigo Xavier Cavazos from Emigre  
or Nick Shinn’s [Walburn](http://web.archive.org/web/20080628180740/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/shinn/walburn/)

What about Storm’s [Amor Pro](http://web.archive.org/web/20080628180740/http:/www.stormtype.com/amor.html)? It is rather modern, and typically personal in that loveable Storm manner. But maybe I am misinterpreting “modern”…

Kris,  
Yours storms to mind as well :-) I wish you would finish it?

ChrisL
Mrs. Eaves is sharp, but not modern at all.
[Mramor](http://web.archive.org/web/20080628180740/http:/www.stormtype.com/mramor.html) from StormType — I don’t think serifs come any sharper.
[Vendôme](http://web.archive.org/web/20080628180740/http:/www.myfonts.com/search?search%5Btext%5D=Vendome), by François Ganeau (Fonderie Olive, 1952, but still feels fresh).

\>I don’t think serifs come any sharper

[Beaufort](http://web.archive.org/web/20080628180740/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/shinn/beaufort/) has infinitely sharp serifs, constrained only by the resolution of the output device.

However, it’s got curved (bracketed) serifs, so may not be “spikey” enough.

It even has a spiky-sounding name: Vendetta

[http://www.emigre.com/EF.php?fid=130](http://web.archive.org/web/20080628180740/http:/www.emigre.com/EF.php?fid=130 "http://www.emigre.com/EF.php?fid=130")

By modernish I think he means modern as storm’s Hercules. Reforma newspaper (México) used a good and economycal modern face, it was called sinergia and recall reading somewhere that the Font Bureau issued it for them, I have not seen it for sale.

Héctor
